(package private) abstract  java.lang.Double Evaluator.evaluatePosition(Player player, GameSituation situation, Position pos)
          Evaluates a position in a game situation for the given player.
protected  java.util.List<EvaluablePosition> Evaluator.getEvaluatedPositions(java.util.List<Position> positionList, Player player)
          Takes a list of positions, evaluates each position, and returns a list of sorted evaluated positions.
protected  java.util.List<Position> Evaluator.getLegalPositions(Player player, GameSituation situation)
          Returns all legally playable positions for a player on a given game situation.
protected  boolean Evaluator.hasOpponents(Player player, GameSituation situation, Position pos)
          Determines, if a position in a situation has one or more neighbor positions, that are occupied by the opponent.
protected  boolean Evaluator.isOpponent(Player player, GameSituation situation, Position position)
          Determines if a position in a situation is occupied by the opponent of a given player.
protected  boolean Evaluator.isThreatened(Player player, GameSituation situation, Position pos)
          Determines if a position in a situation is threatened by the opponnent of a given player.
protected  java.util.ArrayList<Position> Evaluator.opponentsOfPosition(Player player, GameSituation situation, Position pos)
          Lists a positions neighbors, that are occupied by the opponent.

Uses of Player in gameelements
 

Fields in gameelements declared as Player
protected  Player Game.playerA
          This is the white (first, starting) player.
protected  Player Game.playerB
          This is the black (second) player.
 

Methods in gameelements that return Player

          Returns the current active player.
 Player Game.getOpponent(Player player)
          Returns the opponent player of the given player.
 Player Game.getPlayerOfTurn(int turn)
          Returns the current active player of the given turn.
 Player Game.getWinner()
          Returns the winner of the game, null, if game is not won yet.
 

Methods in gameelements with parameters of type Player
 Player Game.getOpponent(Player player)
          Returns the opponent player of the given player.
 boolean Game.isStartingPlayer(Player player)
          Returns true, if the given player is the player who starts the game, else false.
 void Game.makeMove(Player player, Position move)
          Applies move to the current game situation.
 void Game.validateMove(Player player, Position move)
          Checks, if a players move is valid: throw an exception, if inactive player tries to move or if a player tries an illegal move.

Methods in network with parameters of type Player

          Generates a string representation of the game situation according to the 'setup' in an 'initialized'-command.

          Generates a string representation of a single field within a board as used in 'setup' and 'board'.

          Generates a set of 'board'-commands to represent the current game situation.

Client(Player player)

Uses of Player in player
 

Subclasses of Player in player
 class AsynchronousPlayer
          A player that naturally communicates in an ansynchronous manner, if asked for the next move.
 class ComputerPlayer
          Represents the local computer player using the available strategy for generating moves.
 class ConsolePlayer
          Represents a player that connects to the local server by utilizing a service that is acting as client and which is provided by the local server to manage the communication between local game and player.
 class HumanPlayer
          Provides a basic implementation for the human player.
 class RemotePlayer
          A player that represents the remote server, therefore utilizing a local client that connects the local game with the remote server.
 class SynchronousPlayer
          A player who communicates in a synchronous manner if asked for the next move.
 

Methods in player that return Player
static Player Player.createPlayer(java.lang.String name, Game game, GameColor color, int type)
          Factory method for creating the correct player according to the given player type.
 Player Player.getOpponent()
          Returns the opponent player of this player.
